Articles.Content:
Hello Everyone!

Looking at the quantity of great mods developed, such as: Near Future Propulsion Pack, TAC Life support, Ioncross, Remotetech, Interstellar, Biofuels, Deadly Reentry and others.

I've come up with idea to make one mod which encompasses some near future realism aspects from mentioned mods, particularly complex heat&reactor mechanics from Interstellar.

And create some sort of realistic nerdy mod (Excluding the planet sizes) focused on obstacles facing manned interplanetary travel, such as cosmic radiation.

So that when playing this mod you face constant challenges to keep your little green crew alive.

List of proposed mechanics:

- Life support (Air, Water, Waste and Food)

- Hydroponics (Biofuels mod)

- Heat Mechanics

- Fission Reactor Control

- Communication

- Atmospheric Reentry

- Electric Engines

- Cosmic Radiation

- Micrometeorites

- Solar Flares?

What are others not mentioned by me factors/issues in interplanetary manned travel, which could be added here?

Thank you!

Edited November 13, 2013 by Tyrador
Micrometeorites. Also the physiological and psychological effects on kerbals. Sleep, exercise, movement space, recreation, effects of microgravity on bone density.

Micrometeorites. Also the physiological and psychological effects on kerbals. Sleep, exercise, movement space, recreation, effects of microgravity on bone density.

Micrometeorites with damage to solar panels and heat sinks plus change in movement vector of the ship. Micro-gravity will limit the No of Days Kerbals can stay on ship, artificial gravity (centrifuge) module could negate this effect. Recreation, psuchological, sleep and exercise is a hard to implement i guess...not sure about that one.
Insanity? It can get cramped in a 2.5m truncated cone.

As if Kerbals weren't insane already... An extended crew support mod would indeed be nice. It should mesh well with Asmi's ECLSS mod, it does great work at the basics already.

I'd say, remove life support (ECLSS), communications (RemoteTech), electric engines (Near Future Propulsion pack) and reentry (DRE). This mod doesn't need to do them. Now, KSP Interstellar has a lot of overhead with it's modifiable parts and Alcubierre drive, so we should include fission reactor management and heat mechanics. My experience with mods that try to do everything isn't good, support of such thing is difficult and it's usually very complex and not customizable. I'm not a fan of Romfarer's Lazor System nor KSP Interstellar for this very reason.

Radiation management is important in space, so perhaps this should be the initial goal - a radiation management mod. It could do both cosmic radiation and NERVA/fission reactor radiation. Ambient space radiation should go first, then basic reactor simulation (power-only for now) and radiation from NERVAs.

Along with that would come heat. Crew heat management is important, and certain propulsion systems (as well as nuclear reactors) would require another, high-temperature cooling loop. Unlike before, heat management from reactors should come first (using a system similar to KSP Interstellar) and then the crew system.

Now, I think that hydroponics should be a separate, but compatible mod. Perhaps they'd be better done as a late stage of ECLSS mod. Either way, it's not a huge leap from having food and water (which it'll have at some point), so I think that this mod should, if anything, aim to round out the basic implementation.

ECLSS Is Stunning! Thank you for pointing it out! What about Communications? I'd say they are last thing to remove definitely. Near future Propulsion pack has 2 great aspects, first one of the best models in KSP Modding and second it adds challenge with electricity management and is +/- realistic (Which is the point of my mod idea), as well as idea with capacitors. Deadly reentry is another mod that adds challenge and is +/- realistic. I completely agree that mods that try to fit everything is hard to make, but having 100 mods installed and having compatibility issues is a headache. Do you think it is possible to make solar flare radiation releases + general cosmic radiation?

What about Communications? I'd say they are last thing to remove definitely.

Have you seen RemoteTech? It does communication pretty well.

I mentioned it already. And actually, having multiple mods isn't that much of a headache, especially if the creators are cooperating/are the same person (NathanKell is running most of those mods now, or cooperating with people who are). As for KSP interstellar, it's good, but it has a lot of unneeded overhead such as Alcubierre drives, part upgrades and science lab. If we could have a simpler "lite" version featuring just heat/electricity management (and one integrated with stock ElectricCharge system better), it'd be much better. This is what I'd like this mod to be. Electricity, heat and radiation management. This is definitely doable with a plugin.
